alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 8:10AM CDT until August 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in Colorado, Kit Carson and Yuma. In northwest Kansas, Cheyenne and Sherman. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy. * WHEN...From Noon MDT /1 PM CDT/ today through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and continue through the night into Saturday morning. Slow moving, training thunderstorms will be capable of producing rain rates in excess of one inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
